Keywords: Detective , Hydra , Maggia , S.H.I.E.L.D. , Spy , X-Factor , X-Men
Real Name: Jamie Madrox
Special Powers
REABSORPTION: Multiple Man isn't a standard character. // If Multiple Man started the game on click #9, he has a 0 point value for all effects (including scoring). Protected: Pulse Wave.
CREATING NEW DUPES: Multiple Man takes a maximum of 2 damage from attacks. // Whenever Multiple Man takes damage during your opponent's turn, after resolutions generate a XMRF #007 Multiple Man on click #9. (Damage taken is the result after effects that reduce or otherwise affect damage are applied.) Protected: Pulse Wave.

So can things like all the kryptonite colors, and Lantern Objects, The Bookcase, Joker's gas canister, Force field generator, Scorpio key, or the Eleha'al Vine be useable by Multiple man?

foxxwertas
Easiest way to make him a threat to your opponent is play only him on a team. Underworld gets him pretty mobile or find a good modern age taxi that carries more than one. Or heck in silver age pair him with Lila Cheney.. that's my plan for this weekend. 600 point game Lila Cheney x3, 007 Multiple Man x4, XMDPS Madrox @300, and PaH Birthday Deadpool to hand out Goodie Bags to all!

Trait states he's not a standard character, so no equipping him unfortunately.
August 26, 2021
lott750
I'm still sold on this guy. His dupes having Underworld and X-Men Team abilities means they can carry him, empower him, heal him, incapacitate... I mean you're going to need to work something to make him a threat so people do go after him, but like playing casually with equipment on this guy will be fun. I've not played in a while but lurk around looking at new pieces and this one makes me happy.
August 18, 2021
Goop
You know you're probably right. His lack of move and attack hurts but he kinda forces your opponent to hit him for 3 every time unless they want to deal with extra clones. Its far more likely your opponent is just going to ignore him and not touch him. So that mostly makes him a tie up piece. He's probably best served as mastermind fodder, combos well with his leadership.
August 18, 2021
The Singularity
Goop I still think he's pretty good. I mean I was thinking of the same feedback loop potential as you did before - but even now if you look at him at the 40pt dial: he basically has 2 stop clicks, with steal energy. He's guaranteed to generate 2 adjacent copies, has a chance at pulling tokens off of them, and while they lock down a target with incap he might be able to heal up again with steal energy and squirt out another copy or two. I wouldn't underestimate this guy.
August 18, 2021
Goop
I was mistaken in my above comment. If you are killed in an attack, you cannot generate. Generate means you have to place adjacent and if you are gone from the map you cannot generate it next to you. See ruling for Cyclops Sentinel. That makes this guy an average figure at best.
June 6, 2021
Goop
